info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 30 at 2:55PM CDT until August 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FIRE DANGER RESUMES WEDNESDAY... ...BURN BAN CONTINUES FOR ALL OF LOUISIANA AND SOUTHEAST TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY...VERY DRY FUELS...AND GUSTY WINDS... FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS...AS WELL AS ALL OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LOUISIANA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY...VERY DRY FUELS...AND GUSTY WINDS... FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS...AS WELL AS ALL OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LOUISIANA... The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. * AFFECTED AREA...Vernon, Rapides, Avoyelles, Beauregard, Allen, Evangeline, St. Landry, Lafayette, Upper St. Martin, Lower St. Martin, West Cameron, East Cameron, Northern Calcasieu, Northern Jefferson Davis, Northern Acadia, Upper Vermilion, Upper Iberia, Upper St. Mary, Tyler, Hardin, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis, Southern Acadia, Northern Jasper, Northern Newton, Southern Jasper, Southern Newton, Upper Jefferson, Northern Orange, Lower Jefferson and Southern Orange. * TIMING...Until 8 PM Today THEN 10 AM until 8 PM Thursday. * WINDS...Sustained northerly to NNE winds 10 to 15 with gusts up to 25 MPH. Slightly lower tomorrow. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 25% Today (20 to 30% Tomorrow). * TEMPERATURES...95 to 100F both days. * LIGHTNING...Less than a 10% chance of showers and storms across SETX and SWLA with isolated afternoon thunderstorms. Lightning could strike far from the storm center. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Burn bans are in effect across Louisiana and Southeast Texas.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
